definition: close/familiar/intimate/closely (related)/to foster close ties/to pay close attention
surname Mi/name of an ancient state
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: Star Wars are closely linked to conventional ground-combat.
sentences.chinese: 星球大战与地面常规作战之间有着密切的联系。

sentences.english: Hand-in-glove with radar was battle management.
sentences.chinese: 与雷达密切相关的是战斗管理。

sentences.english: The Chinese government has demanded that U.S.-led NATO bear all responsibilities for this incident, and the Chinese side will continue to pay close attention to the development of the matter.
sentences.chinese: 中方将继续密切关注情况的发展。

sentences.english: This inhibiting effect was due chiefly to the concentration of combined nitrogen.
sentences.chinese: 化合态氮的抑制作用与浓度密切相关。

sentences.english: There exists a close relationship between plants and chiral compounds.
sentences.chinese: 植物与手性化合物存在着非常密切的联系。

sentences.english: Liverpool, meanwhile, are monitoring the young Preston North End midfielder Adam Barton.
sentences.chinese: 利物浦对普瑞斯顿的中场巴顿密切关注中。

sentences.english: Both groups of diseases are strongly associated with poverty.
sentences.chinese: 这两种病都与贫穷有很密切的联系。

sentences.english: Relative study of event-related potentials elicited by calculating and number recognizing;
sentences.chinese: 与另一事件经常伴随发生或者密切相关的事件。

sentences.english: Commander-in-chief that Eastern Jin set up has intimate relations with generals.
sentences.chinese: 东晋国家设置的都督诸州军事与将军职有密切的关系。

sentences.english: Keeping close contact with the masses is a good tradition of our Party.
sentences.chinese: 密切联系群众是我们党的优良传统。

sentences.english: Jianchaling gold deposit is closed related to the Jianchaling ultrabasic rock mass.
sentences.chinese: 煎茶岭金矿与煎茶岭超基性岩体有密切的成因联系。

sentences.english: There was high relationship between gingival hyperplasia and the whole blood concentration of ciclosporin in 7 patients.
sentences.chinese: 有7例牙龈增生与环孢素血药浓度密切相关。

sentences.english: Zhou Dynasty's historiographers and Zhouli have a close relationship.
sentences.chinese: 周代史官与周礼之间有着密切的关系。

sentences.english: Don’t shy away from talking to people. Connect or reconnect with people who are still employed.
sentences.chinese: 不要羞于跟人讨论，与在职的人保持密切的联系。

sentences.english: The reference and Citation in academic papers closely relate to intellectual property.
sentences.chinese: 学述论著中的参考引文与知识产权有着密切的关系。

sentences.english: TAM and PHC may be closely related to the tumor angiogenesis.
sentences.chinese: TAM与PHC的血管生成可能有着密切的关系。

definition: relation/relationship/to concern/to affect/to have to do with/guanxi/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 關係|关系[guan1 xi5]
to attach importance to sth/to value
variant of 聯繫|联系[lian2 xi4]
connection/contact/relation/to get in touch with/to integrate/to link/to touch
to get in touch with/to contact/to stay in contact (with)/liaison/(math.) connection
to share the same interests (idiom)/to be closely related/to be in the same boat
harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
to be mindful/to pay attention to/to take note of
